name: The Westin Resort & Spa, Whistler

reviews.text: One of my favourite hotels in Whistler. The location is great since it's right in the village and right by the slopes, almost a ski in and ski out.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms can be a bit cramped for suites but if you get upgraded there are several that are very spacious and have a nice view. I think all the rooms have been renovated but I'd make sure just in case.
reviews.title: For convenience and best of both worlds ( hotel / Condo) this is a great option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa facilities are pretty decent too with several outside pools, although not as spacious as the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Wonderful Whistler hotel

reviews.text: The Japanese restaurant in the hotel is amazing as well.
reviews.title: Nice but some negatives
Four nights, 3 day skiing stay.
reviews.text: It is a pricey property but on par with other top end hotels in the village.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ‘sharp’ talk in the limo from the airport was that the Westin was too far from the lifts and the service was rude and unfriendly. Not a great start perhaps but the observations were way off.
reviews.title: Yes - would definitely return.

reviews.text: The hotel is no more than a 3 minute walk from the lifts. The room was large, comfortable and well appointed. The in-room kitchen looked after us well and the staff were friendly and eager to please. A stubborn room safe was fixed quickly and efficiently. Housekeeping even sent the birthday girl a birthday card and a bottle of bubbly (thank you Murjitt). The ski valet was (contrary to reports, free) helpful, friendly and efficient. The Firerock Lounge was welcoming and relaxing after a hard days skiing and the wings were the best of our stay.
reviews.title: Excellently located base in Whistler

reviews.text: We would gladly stay at the Westin again or recommend to friends and all.
reviews.title: Ski in Ski out luxury with enough room for the family!

reviews.text: That said, here are some additional details the management could still improve upon: (a) better pillows and bedding (b) wall hooks or a means of drying wet ski clothing (something more than just the gas fire) (c) despite the complementary Starbucks filter sachets, surely a hotel of this size and distinction can run to a coffee shop? (d) likewise, surely a hotel of this size and distinction could offer free wi-fi rather than see Westin customers visit other hotel lobbies or coffee shops?
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we were very happy with our stay at the Westin. We booked using points and were given a somewhat dungeon-like room on the 3rd floor (lowest level of rooms). After requesting a better one, we were moved to a much nicer room on a higher floor that actually received natural light.
reviews.title: Great location, terrific staff, could use a refreshing

reviews.text: The rooms have a bed, sitting area, gas fireplaces, and surprisingly, a full kitchen.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel somewhat lacking in finer details.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is terrific - everything is within walking distance. The staff was incredibly helpful with everything from free shuttle service to restaurant/spa reservations.
reviews.title: Good hotel, beware about the extra charges

reviews.text: One of the biggest problems was with the Internet. While the hotel has wifi, it was spotty at best. It was actually shocking how we were unable to maintain a decent connection on any of our devices. How difficult is this in 2012??
reviews.title: Good hotel, superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in August of 2011 as part of a little adventure trip that we won to Whistler. We decided to extend the stay for a couple more nights.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The lobby is very impressive and provides a great first impression. Check in process was quick and friendly and they upgrade our room to a mountain view without asking. When we asked where the nightlife was, they showed us a map and gave us a night by night schedule on where the locals go - and the advice was very accurate. We were in a junior suite that overlooked Whistler mountain and the gondolas. The room, as well as the bathroom, was clean and spacious. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The kitchenette in our junior suite was stocked with everything we needed.
reviews.title: Whistler Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their pans are not teflon and we burned our breakfast each morning. As there are no vents in the room and the only window is at the other side of the suite, it was hard to get the smokey smell out of our room. The bathroom tub also had an issue when draining and despite leaving a note for housekeeping, it was not fixed the next morning.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

aka: The Westin Resort And Spa, Whistler
description: Located in Whistler Village just yards from the gondolas and the slopes of Whistler and Blackcomb mountains, The Westin Resort & Spa, Whistler is an all-suite, full-service conference hotel and spa.
